Dialogue: This is the end, my friend.  Thank you for calling!

Speaker: dade
Dialogue: Oh, shit! He got me.

Speaker: nikon
Dialogue: Joey's getting stupid busy.

Speaker: dade
Dialogue: Joey. I need you to drop your viruses, go after the worm. You're the closest.

Speaker: dade
Dialogue: It's root slash period workspace slash period garbage period.

Speaker: gill
Dialogue: Freeze!

Speaker: gill
Dialogue: Ahhh Come on!

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: Kill the Gibson.

Speaker: razor
Dialogue: Roger that.

Speaker: plague
Dialogue: Come on you son of a bitch, is that all you got, huh? Come on, let's see what else you can do! You talking to me? Huh? Hahahaha. Are you nuts? Come at me!

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: They're in the kernal.

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: The tankers have stopped capsizing.

Speaker: someone else
Dialogue: Ballast tanks are emptying. It'll be okay.

Speaker: plague
Dialogue: Little pissant!

Speaker: nikon
Dialogue: Yes!

Speaker: dade
Dialogue: We did it!

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: Let's get out of here!

Speaker: gill
Dialogue: FREEZE!

Speaker: dade
Dialogue: They're TRASHING our rights, man! They're TRASHING the flow of data! They're TRASHING! TRASHING! TRASHING! HACK THE PLANET! HACK THE PLANET!

Speaker: gill
Dialogue: Shut up and get in the car!

Speaker: cereal
Dialogue: HACK THE PLANET! HACK THE PLANET!

Speaker: plague
Dialogue: Hello?

Speaker: gill
Dialogue: We caught 'em.

Speaker: plague
Dialogue: Good.

Speaker: gill
Dialogue: Red handed! You won't be having any more trouble from them.

Speaker: dade
Dialogue: Me, alright? I did it. She knows shit about computers. She... she's just my girlfriend.

Speaker: gill
Dialogue: I suggest you modify your attitude. Because you are floating. And I'm about to flush your ass.

Speaker: agent
Dialogue: You've got a Mrs. Murphy to see you, sir.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: Are you crazy? What are you doing?

Speaker: dade
Dialogue: I'm trying to help you.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: Dade.

Speaker: dade
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: Thanks for your help.

Speaker: gill
Dialogue: Your son is in big trouble. He has violated his probation and he has engaged in criminal activity.

Speaker: agent bob
Dialogue: The news crew you requested is here.

Speaker: gill
Dialogue: Your son is facing thirty felony counts in an ongoing investigation. You face possible arrest if you do that.

Speaker: gill
Dialogue: Mrs. Murphy stays right here.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: Oh, wow, she's great.

Speaker: dade
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: reporter
Dialogue: ...and attacked the Ellingson's computer network. Is the last we've seen of this type of high-tech espionage?

Speaker: gill
Dialogue: Well, I'm afraid not. Hackers are a grave threat to the national security. This incident just proves without a doubt that we need increased funding to stop...

Speaker: someone
Dialogue: That kid cut him off!

Speaker: cereal
Dialogue: Hold on, boys and girls. It is I, the Cereal Killer, making my first coast to coast, world wide, global television appearance. Yes, that's right, I'm here to tell you about this heinous scheme hatched from within Ellingson Mineral.

Speaker: cereal
Dialogue: But for what, you ask? World domination? Nay. Something far more tacky. A virus called Da Vinci, that when launched, would cause Ellingson Mineral tankers to capsize was to be blamed on innocent hackers. But this virus was really the smokescreen, right. What could be so vitally important to protect that someone would create such a nasty, antisocial, very uncool virus program?

Speaker: cereal
Dialogue: But why? Could it be to cover the tracks for this worm program? A worm that was to steal 25 million bucks. The password for this hungry little sucker belongs to Margo Wallace, head of public relations at Ellingson Mineral...

Speaker: margo
Dialogue: Oh my God!

Speaker: cereal
Dialogue: ...and Eugene Belford, Computer Security Officer.

Speaker: gill
Dialogue: Son of a BITCH!

Speaker: cereal
Dialogue: What's this? Is this the unnamed account in the Bahamas where the money was to be stashed? I think so!

Speaker: cereal
Dialogue: Yo. I kinda feel like God!

Speaker: margo
Dialogue: Plague? Eugene?

Speaker: margo
Dialogue: I don't even know how to work a VCR, let alone a computer! Get off! Look, listen, I'll make a deal. Eugene Belford! I know where his mother is, I promise you. Get offa me! I need a lawyer!

Speaker: stewardess
Dialogue: Here you are, Mr. Babbage.  Flight time to Tokyo should be about 14 hours today. Can I get you anything else?

Speaker: plague
Dialogue: Just a pillow please.

Speaker: plague
Dialogue: Thank you.

Speaker: gill
Dialogue: You're welcome.

Speaker: plague
Dialogue: What's going on? Let go of me! Stewardess! I'll never fly this airline again!

Dialogue: You look good in a dress.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: You would have looked better.

Speaker: dade
Dialogue: Wanna go for a swim?

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: I can't believe they decided you won.

Speaker: dade
Dialogue: They didn't. The guys felt it was the only way I'd get a date. Anyway, you're pretty good. You're elite.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: Yeah? You know if you would have said so in the beginning, you would have saved yourself a whole lot of trouble.

Speaker: dade
Dialogue: Beat that!
